pyMotif.demo module¶

pyMotif.enums module¶

Enumerated types for base pairs, nucleotides and motifs. Assist with ensuring type correctness and lowers overhead vs string-based implementations.

enums

pyMotif.enums.ALLOWED_PAIRS = {'AU', 'CG', 'GC', 'GU', 'UA', 'UG'}¶

A set() containing all 6 canonical and wobble basepairings.

pyMotif.enums.BASEPAIR_MAPPER = {'AU': <BasePair.AU: 2>, 'CG': <BasePair.CG: 5>, 'GC': <BasePair.GC: 4>, 'GU': <BasePair.GU: 0>, 'UA': <BasePair.UA: 3>, 'UG': <BasePair.UG: 1>}¶

A dict() object that maps a canonical basepair to its BasePair() value.

pyMotif.enums.BPS = ('GU', 'UG', 'AU', 'UA', 'GC', 'CG')¶

A tuple() of allowed canonical and wobble basepairings. Ordered for easy conversion by the BasePair() class.

pyMotif.enums.BP_VALS = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5]¶

A list() that contains the integer values for all of the BasePair() enumerations.

class pyMotif.enums.BasePair(value)¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

Enumerated type for canoncial and wobble basepairs.

AU = 2¶
CG = 5¶
GC = 4¶
GU = 0¶
UA = 3¶
UG = 1¶
is_AU()¶
Returns

If the instance is a UA or AU pair.

Return type

bool()

is_GC()¶
Returns

If the instance is a CG or GC pair.

Return type

bool()

is_GU()¶
Returns

If the instance is a UG or GU pair.

Return type

bool()

is_canoncial()¶
Returns

If the instance is a canonical Watson-Crick basepair.

Return type

bool()

to_str()¶
Returns

The BasePair() instance in text form.

Return type

str()

pyMotif.enums.LEGAL_BPS = {'A', 'C', 'G', 'U'}¶

A set() of all 4 allowed nucleotide types.

class pyMotif.enums.MotifType(value)¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

Enumerated type for all motif types

HAIRPIN = 3¶
HELIX = 2¶
JUNCTION = 4¶
SINGLESTRAND = 1¶
UNASSIGNED = 0¶
pyMotif.enums.NTS = ('A', 'C', 'G', 'U')¶

A tuple() of all 4 canonical nucleotide types. Ordered for each conversion by the Nucleotide() class.

pyMotif.enums.NT_VALS = [0, 1, 2, 3]¶

A list() that contains the integer values for all of the Nucleotide() enumerations.

pyMotif.enums.NUCLEOTIDE_MAPPER = {'A': <Nucleotide.A: 0>, 'C': <Nucleotide.C: 1>, 'G': <Nucleotide.G: 2>, 'U': <Nucleotide.U: 3>}¶

A dict() object that maps a canoncial nucleotide to its Nucleotide() value.

class pyMotif.enums.Nucleotide(value)¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

Enumerated type for all nucleotide types.

C = 1¶
G = 2¶
U = 3¶

pyMotif.motif module¶

Motif classes that serve as the driver for this library’s functionality.

class pyMotif.motif.Motif(**kwargs)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract base class that Hairpin(), Helix(), Junction() and SingleStrand() all inherit from.
